column7: Healthy, Vaccine, Covid-19, Rheumatoid Arthritis, Tumor
column12: 52 gene expression programs derived from T-cells across 7 reference datasets. Includes derived discrete and continuous scores for predicting proliferation and antigen-specific activation (ASA), as well as discrete labels for T-cell lineage. See publication for details.

14 gene expression programs derived from myeloid cells in 85 human gliomas. These include cell types (Microglia, Neutrophil, Macrophage, MonocyteC1Q, cDC) and other cell states (Immunosuppressive, Scavenger, Immunosuppressive, G2-M, IFN Response, IL1B, Inflammatory, G1-S, Hypoxia, CXCR4, Inflammatory, HS-UPR). See publication for details.

35 gene expression programs (GEPs) derived from CD34+ hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells (HSPCs) at 12 time points across human development, from 10 weeks post-gestation to 45 years of age (1-2 donors per time point). The publication describing these GEPs is in press at Nature Methods but the initial preprint describing the dataset is described in https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2021.08.25.457678v1. Contained GEPs include the following: Dendritic cell, Ribosomal protein enriched, postnatal HSC, Erythrocyte, Megakaryocyte, Macrophage, fetal myeloid, basophil/mast cell, Lymphoid, cord blood, fetal HSC, Neutrophil, Erythroid. GEPs with two gene names separated by a "/" lack a clear interpretation and may represent dataset specific noise.
